meanings.definition: In a deliberate and unprovoked manner.
meanings.sent1: She ran wantonly through the field, laughing joyfully.
meanings.sent2: The cat pounced wantonly on the unsuspecting mouse.
meanings.sent3: The children played wantonly in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled wantonly through the deserted streets.
meanings.sent5: The flames danced wantonly in the fireplace, casting shadows on the walls.

meanings.definition: Without regard for what is right or moral.
meanings.sent1: The wantonly cruel bully tormented the smaller kids at school.
meanings.sent2: Her wantonly selfish actions hurt those around her.
meanings.sent3: The wantonly careless driver caused a major accident on the highway.
meanings.sent4: The wantonly dishonest businessman cheated his partners out of their fair share.
meanings.sent5: The wantonly destructive storm left a path of destruction in its wake.

meanings.sent1: She decorated the house wantonly for the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The chef sprinkled spices wantonly into the simmering pot.
meanings.sent3: The singer belted out the song wantonly, hitting every high note perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted wantonly, creating a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky wantonly, dazzling the spectators below.
